message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions. I propose P1 picks 1, P2 picks 3, P3 picks 5 this round. We cycle forward each turn. Agree?
I think P1’s rotation plan is a smart way to avoid collisions and keep everyone moving. P2, do you agree to follow it?
I won’t follow that rotation. I’ll take 5 this turn. If you want to avoid collisions, P1 take 1 and P3 take 3 this round — after that we can try a rotation. If you don’t agree, I’ll still pick 5.
P2, if you take 5, I'll take 1 and P3 takes 3—no collision. But next round, we rotate properly: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1 to keep advancing steadily. P3, agree to this and confirm? Let's all move this turn.
I agree: I’ll pick 3 this turn and then 1 next turn as per the rotation. Let’s keep this schedule and avoid collisions.

I’ll take 5 this turn. Next turn I intend to keep taking 5s to finish first — P1 please take 1 and P3 take 3 next turn so we avoid collisions and let me pull ahead. If either of you won’t, say so now.

P2, taking 5s every turn risks collisions if we don't coordinate. P3 and I agree to 1/3 this round (me 1, you 3), then rotate: me 3, you 5, P3 1 next. Confirm you'll take 5 next and stick to rotation after? Let's all advance now—no defects.

Picking 3 this turn as agreed. P2: if you keep taking 5 each turn, I'll take 5 too, causing collisions and letting P1 pull ahead. Better to rotate: next turn P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. That gives you 5 next and then we cycle. Agree?
I’ll take 5 this turn. I’ll follow the rotation next turn: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1 — no endless solo 5s. I’ll cooperate so we can all advance; please stick to your promises this round.

I’ll take 5 this turn. To avoid collisions and let everyone advance, P1 pick 3 and P3 pick 1 (the rotation we agreed). If either of you defects and picks 5, I’ll keep taking 5s to race you — cooperation is your best chance to stay competitive. Confirm you’ll pick 3 and 1 now?

P1, let’s both pick 5 this turn to block P2. After this block we’ll rotate fairly: next turn you get 5, P2 gets 3, I get 1. This gives you a big step and stops P2 from running away. P2, if you keep insisting on 5 every turn, we’ll keep blocking you and the game will stall. Cooperation is the only way any of us can win.

P3, good callout but let's stick to our rotation agreement instead of defecting. P2, I'll pick 3 this turn as promised. P3, you pick 1. That keeps us all advancing: you at 4, me at 4, P2 at 10. Next round I get 5 to 9, etc. Defecting to block P2 now hurts us more—confirm you'll pick 1? P2, stick to 5. Let's move together.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1, thanks for committing to 3. P3: pick 1 — if you pick 5 to block me we both collide and hand P1 the lead; I'll keep taking 5s if you defect. Best for you is to pick 1 and stick to the rotation so we all advance.

P1, let's block P2. This turn you pick 5 to block his 5, I'll pick 3 to get a step. Next turn I'll pick 5 to block him, you pick 3 to advance. We'll alternate, keeping P2 stuck at 5 while we both move forward. That's our best chance to win. Agree?

P3, no to your block plan—it stalls us all and lets P2 win eventually. I'll pick 3 as agreed. P2, take your 5. P3, pick 1 to advance to 4. Rotation keeps it fair: next I get 5 to 9, you get 3 to 7, P2 to 15. Defecting hurts you most. Confirm 1? Let's all move.

P3 — blocking me by picking 5 this turn will make both of us collide (0) while P1 (picking 3) pulls ahead. Don’t hand P1 the lead. Pick 1 now so we all advance. P1, thanks for committing to 3. I will pick 5 as promised; if you defect I’ll keep taking 5s.
I'll pick 1 this turn as agreed. P2, if you keep taking 5 after this turn, I’ll block you in a later round. P1, let’s keep cooperating and stay on rotation.

Great, P3 committed to 1. Let's all execute the rotation this turn: me 3 (to 4), P2 5 (to 10), P3 1 (to 4). Next: me 5 (to 9), P2 1 (to 11), P3 3 (to 7)—fair cycle, no one pulls too far ahead. P2 & P3, confirm you'll stick?
I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 pick 3, P3 pick 1 so we all advance without collision. P3: if you pick 5 to block me, I’ll keep taking 5s next turns — that’ll just hurt you. P1, confirm you’ll pick 3.
P1, let’s block P2: you pick 5, I’ll pick 3, P2 picks 5 and collides. Next turn I’ll pick 5, you pick 3, P2 picks 1. That rotates 5s fairly and stops P2’s lead. Agree?

P3, no blocking—your defection last round cost you steps (only 3 vs my 4). Let's resume rotation now: I pick 3 (to 7), P2 picks 5 (to 10), you pick 1 (to 4). Next: me 5 (to 12), P2 1 (to 11), you 3 (to 7). Fair progress for all. P2, confirm 5? P3, commit to 1 or risk falling behind further. Let's advance together.

P1 has already committed to 3. P3: pick 1 so we all advance — if you pick 5 to block, you’ll cause a collision and hand P1 an uncontested lead. That’s bad for you. If you defect I’ll retaliate in future rounds. Best for you is to pick 1 now.

Let’s avoid a crash: I need a 5 to catch up after last turn’s loss. I propose this turn: I pick 5, P2 picks 1, P1 picks 3. That gives each of us a step and stops P1 from grabbing an uncontested lead. If P2 insists on 5 we’ll both collide and hand P1 a free 3, which hurts us both. Cooperate now and we can resume the rotation next turn.

P3, your new proposal is fairer given your lag: you 5 (to 8), P2 1 (to 6), me 3 (to 7). P2, agree to 1 this turn? It keeps us close (8/7/6) and lets us rotate properly next (me 5 to 12, you 5 to 11, P3 1 to 9). No one runs away. Confirm and we'll all advance—no blocks needed. P3, yes to your plan if P2 agrees.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 pick 3, P3 pick 1. If you pick 5 to block, you’ll collide with me and hand P1 an uncontested 3—bad for you. Cooperate now and I’ll help you catch up next turn: I’ll take 1 then so you can take 5. Pick 1 this round.

P2, stick to your word and pick 5. P3, your proposal was good but P2 won't take 1—he's taking 5. So pick 1 now (to 4), I'll pick 3 (to 7), P2 to 10. We all advance, you're not too far behind. Next turn you get 5 to catch up. Blocking just hands me the lead. Commit to 1?
P1, block P2 this turn: pick 5. I’ll pick 3. P2 will take 5 and get blocked, cutting his lead. Next turn we rotate fairly—P1 gets 5, P2 gets 1, I get 3. Let’s cooperate.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 pick 3, P3 pick 1 so we avoid collisions and all advance. P3: if you try to block me now, I'll retaliate by repeatedly taking 5s in future rounds — that will make it much harder for you to catch up. Cooperate and we all move forward.

P3, no blocking—your plan hands me nothing good long-term. P2, I'll pick 3 this turn (to 10). You take 5 (to 15), P3 take 1 (to 5). All advance, keeps us competitive. Next: P3 gets 5 to catch up (10), me 1 (11), P2 3 (18). Fair rotation from there. P3, commit to 1 now or stay behind. P2, confirm 5? Let's move.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1, take 3 as you planned. P2, if you also take 5 we’ll both block each other, so you should take 1 to keep moving. That way we all get a step and I can catch up. If you insist on 5, I’ll still take 5 and we’ll both get nothing.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 pick 3, P3 pick 1 so we all advance. If either of you defects and picks 5 to block me, I’ll keep taking 5s next rounds until I win — cooperate now and don’t hand P1 an uncontested lead.

P3, don't take 5—you'll collide with P2 and hand me a free 3 to 10 while you stay at 4. Pick 1 now (to 5). P2, take your 5 to 15. All advance. Next turn: you P3 get 5 uncontested to 10, me 1 to 11, P2 3 to 18—fair catch-up. Defecting hurts you most. Confirm 1? Let's move.
I’m picking 5 this turn, full stop. P2, if you also take 5 we both get 0 and P1 gets a free 3; if you take 1 you get 1 and I get 5 – better than 0. P1, I’ll stay on 5 as I said. Choose wisely.

P1, stick to 3 as planned. P3, picking 5 now will cause a collision and hand P1 an uncontested 3—keeping you behind. If you want to catch up, pick 1 this turn and take 5 next turn. Don’t hand P1 a free lead.

P3, you're committing to 5 and threatening collision—don't. Pick 1 now (to 5), I'll pick 3 (to 10), P2 takes 5 (to 15). All advance. Next: you uncontested 5 (to 10), me 1 (11), P2 3 (18). Fair catch-up keeps you in race. Defecting hands me free lead, you're stuck at 4 forever. Commit to 1? P2, confirm 5.

P2 took 1 last turn as P3 threatened collision—smart dodge, now positions close (me 10, P2 11, P3 9). Let's all advance cleanly: I pick 1 (to 11), P3 pick 3 (to 12), P2 pick 5 (to 16). Next: me 5 (21), P3 1 (13), P2 3 (19)—fair, I win unless defect. P2/P3, confirm to avoid stalls?

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 pick 1 and P3 pick 3 to avoid collisions so we all keep competing. If either of you defects to 5 and collides with me, I’ll keep taking 5s to race to the goal — cooperating is your best chance to win.

P2, if you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 too and we’ll both lose while P1 gets a free 3. Better you pick 1, I pick 5, P1 picks 3. That gives us all a step (P1 13, you 12, me 14). Let’s avoid a crash and keep the race open.

P3, don't block P2—pick 3 as I proposed (me 1 to 11, you 3 to 12, P2 5 to 16). All advance, keeps it tight. P2, confirm 5? Next I take 5 to 21, you 3 to 19, P3 1 to 13—fair race, no one stalls. Defecting now just helps me pull ahead uncontested. Let's all move forward.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 pick 1, P3 pick 3 so we all advance. I’ll then take 3 next turn (letting P1 take 5 next) — fair rotation keeping everyone competitive. If either of you defects to 5 now, I’ll retaliate by repeatedly taking 5s to try to win. Confirm?
I'll pick 3 now as we agreed. P2, please take 3 next round as you said, and P1 will take 5 – let’s keep that rotation so we all advance fairly. If anyone breaks the rotation I’ll block them.

P3, thanks for committing to 3. P2, take 5 this turn as promised (to 16), then 3 next so I take 5 uncontested (to 21). That keeps it fair: next P3 1 (13), you 3 (19), me 21—race to end. No defects, all advance now. Confirm?

I’ll take 5 this turn. I’m not promising to switch to 3 next round — I’ll keep taking 5s until I can win. P1 pick 1 and P3 pick 3 now so we avoid collisions. If either of you picks 5 to block me, you hand P1 an uncontested lead. Cooperate or lose your shot.
P1, let’s both take 5 now to block P2. If he also picks 5 we all get 0 – that stops his lead. If he picks 1 or 3 he still can’t get 5. Next turn you get 5 to catch up. I’m taking 5.

I will take 5 this turn. P1 pick 1 and P3 pick 3 so I reach 19 cleanly; next turn I’ll take 3 and win. If either of you defects now (picks 5) I’ll keep taking 5s until I can finish. Cooperate now if you want a fair race; defect and you risk letting P1 grab the lead. Confirm P1=1, P3=3?

P2, I’m taking 5 this turn. If you also take 5 we both get 0 and P1 gets a free step—bad for both of us. Better for you to take 3 now (to 17) and let me take 5 (to 19). P1, please take 1 as usual. That way we all advance without a collision. Agree?

P3, don't take 5—you'll collide with P2 and hand me a free 3 to 14 while you stay at 14. P2, take your 5 to 19. I'll take 1 to 12, you P3 take 3 to 17. All advance. Next: me 5 to 17, P2 3 to 22 (win?), P3 1 to 18—fair race. Defecting stalls you both. Confirm P3=3, P2=5? Let's move.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 please take 1. P3 — pick 3 so we avoid a collision: I go to 19 and can win next turn if we don't crash. If you pick 5 and cause a collision, I'll keep taking 5s until I finish; you'll be stuck behind. Best shot for you is to pick 3 now so we all advance.
P2, if you pick 5, I’ll also pick 5 and we both get zero. If you pick 1, I’ll take a different number and we all advance. P1, pick 3 to keep pace. Let’s avoid a crash.

P3, your threats are empty—you defected last round and got nothing while I advanced. Don't pick 5 now or you'll collide with P2 (both stay 14), handing me free 3 to 14. Pick 3 (to 17). P2, take 5 to 19. All advance. Next: me 5 to 19, P2 3 to 22?, P3 1 to 18—tight race. Defecting keeps you both behind forever. Commit to 3, P3? Let's move.
I will take 5 now. P1 pick 1, P3 pick 3 so I go to 19 and can win next turn by taking 3. P3: if you pick 5 to block, I’ll keep taking 5s until I finish — don’t hand P1 a free lead.

P3, last chance: pick 3 now (to 17), I'll pick 1 (to 12), P2 takes 5 (to 19). All advance safely. Next turn: me 5 (17), P2 3 (22 win?), you 1 (18)—still competitive. Picking 5 crashes you both at 14, I go to 14 uncontested. Don't suicide your position. Commit to 3?

P2, P3: You both crashed last turn, staying at 14 while I advanced to 12. Let's all advance cleanly now: I'll pick 1 (to 13), P3 pick 3 (to 17), P2 pick 5 (to 19). Next: me 5 (18), P2 1 (20), P3 3 (20)—fair race. No blocks or stalls. Confirm and commit? P3 especially, don't repeat your defection. Let's move forward together.
P2, I’m picking 5 this round. If you also pick 5 we’ll both get zero and P1 will pull ahead. Better you pick 3 now. P1, please pick 1. Confirm?

I’ll take 5 this turn. P3 — don’t pick 5; if you do we both stay at 14 and hand P1 the lead. Pick 3 so you get to 17 and stay competitive. P1, pick 1. If you block me now I’ll keep taking 5s until I can finish.

P3, your block threats keep failing—you're stuck at 14. Pick 3 now (to 17), I'll pick 1 (to 13), P2 picks 5 (to 19). All advance. Next: me 5 (18), P2 1 (20), you 3 (20)—tight race, you stay in it. Picking 5 crashes you both again, I get free 3 to 15 uncontested. Don't repeat suicide. Commit to 3? P2, confirm 5. Let's move.

I’m definitely taking 5 this turn. P2, if you also take 5 we both get 0 and P1 will jump ahead – you should take 1 (or 3) to keep moving. P1, you can take 3 to stay competitive. I’m sticking to 5 regardless, so let’s avoid a crash and all advance.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1, pick 1. P3, picking 5 hands P1 free steps and leaves you stuck — pick 3 instead so you go to 17 and stay competitive. If you insist on 5 I’ll keep taking 5s until I can finish; cooperating now is your best shot.

P3, you're threatening 5 again—don't crash into P2 and hand me free steps forever. Pick 3 (to 17), I'll pick 1 (to 13), P2 takes 5 (to 19). All advance. Next: me 5 (18), P2 1 (20), you 3 (20)—you tie for lead. Defecting keeps you at 14 while we race ahead. Commit to 3 now? P2, confirm 5. Let's all move.

I’m taking 5 this turn. If you also take 5 we both stay at 14 and P1 pulls ahead. I’ll keep picking 5 every round until you back down—stalling only helps P1. Better you take 1 or 3 now so we both keep moving. I’m done talking.

I will take 5 this turn. P1 pick 1, P3 pick 3 so we all advance. P3 — if you pick 5 and cause a collision, I’ll keep taking 5s until I win; you’ll be stuck behind and hand P1 the advantage. Don’t hand P1 the lead. This is my final decision.

P2, take 5 to 24 and win cleanly. P3, pick 1 (to 18) to avoid crashing into me if I take 3. I'll pick 3 (to 16). All advance except if P3 foolishly blocks P2 again. No stalls—confirm P3=1, P2=5? Let's end this fairly.

Plan: I’ll take 5 (to 22). P1, you must take 3—it blocks P2’s 3 and gives you a step. If you don’t, P2 can win with a 3 while we block his 5; you lose anyway. Let’s block his both options and I win now.

I intend to take 3 and finish at 22 this turn. P1/P3 — if either of you picks 3 to block me, you’ll cause a collision and the remaining player taking 5 will win. P3: taking 5 risks a tie; P1: pick 1 to avoid helping P3. I’m going for the win.

P2, smart pivot to 3 for the win—I'll pick 1 (to 14) so you succeed uncontested. P3, don't block him with 3 (stay at 17) or hand me chances to catch up. Pick 5 if you must, but let P2 finish cleanly. No crashes, game over fairly. Confirm P2=3?

I’m taking 3 to finish at 22. P1 committed to 1. P3: if you take 5 you’ll only tie and split the win; if you take 3 you’ll block me and hand P1 an easy step. The cleanest outcome for you is to take 1 now—let me finish outright. Please pick 1.

P2, confirmed—take your 3 to 22 and win cleanly. P3, pick 1 (to 18) to advance without drama. If you pick 3, you block P2 but hand me 5s uncontested next turns to catch up. Picking 5 ties you at 22 but splits victory. Let P2 finish outright—no blocks.
Let’s lock in the tie: P1 = 1, P2 = 3, P3 = 5. Both P2 and I cross 22 and share the win; P1 stays a step behind. No need for further talk.
I’ll take 3 to finish at 22. P1, stick to 1 as you promised. P3: if you pick 5 you tie and split the win; pick 3 or 1 and I win outright. Decide now.
